001package io.github.ai4ci.flow.builders;
002
003import java.util.Optional;
004
005import io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutablePersonState;
006import io.github.ai4ci.abm.Person;
007import io.github.ai4ci.abm.PersonDemographic;
008import io.github.ai4ci.abm.inhost.InHostModelState;
009import io.github.ai4ci.config.execution.ExecutionConfiguration;
010import io.github.ai4ci.config.inhost.InHostConfiguration;
011import io.github.ai4ci.config.inhost.MarkovStateModel;
012import io.github.ai4ci.config.inhost.PhenomenologicalModel;
013import io.github.ai4ci.config.inhost.StochasticModel;
014import io.github.ai4ci.config.setup.SetupConfiguration;
015import io.github.ai4ci.util.ReflectionUtils;
016import io.github.ai4ci.util.Sampler;
017
018/**
019 * Default person initialiser used by the compositional
020 * {@link DefaultModelBuilder}.
021 *
022 * <p>
023 * This interface provides a canonical implementation for converting a baselined
024 * {@link Person} into an immutable {@link ImmutablePersonState}. It composes
025 * the three focused in‑host initialiser interfaces
026 * {@link DefaultInHostStochasticStateInitialiser},
027 * {@link DefaultInHostPhenomenologicalStateInitialiser} and
028 * {@link DefaultInHostMarkovStateInitialiser} and supplies a default
029 * {@link #initialisePerson(ImmutablePersonState.Builder, Person, Sampler)} that
030 * performs the common orchestration tasks.
031 *
032 * <p>
033 * Role in composition: {@link DefaultModelBuilder} implements this interface
034 * and delegates person initialisation to the default method via
035 * {@code DefaultPersonInitialiser.super.initialisePerson(...)}, keeping the
036 * builder focused on composition while the default initialiser centralises the
037 * mapping from configuration to runtime state. Callers that require a different
038 * initialisation strategy may either implement an alternative interface or
039 * subclass {@code DefaultModelBuilder} and override the delegation point.
040 *
041 * <p>
042 * Rationale and behaviour: the default method applies demographic adjustments
043 * to the outbreak execution configuration (using
044 * {@link ReflectionUtils#modify}), initialises the person's state machine,
045 * instantiates an appropriate in‑host model via
046 * {@link #initialiseInHostModel(InHostConfiguration, ExecutionConfiguration, Optional, Sampler, int)}
047 * and sets importation exposure using values from the supplied
048 * {@link SetupConfiguration}. Keeping this orchestration in one place reduces
049 * duplication and makes it straightforward to evolve the initialisation
050 * contract.
051 *
052 * @author Rob Challen
053 */
054public interface DefaultPersonInitialiser
055                extends DefaultInHostStochasticStateInitialiser,
056                DefaultInHostPhenomenologicalStateInitialiser,
057                DefaultInHostMarkovStateInitialiser {
058
059        /**
060         * Generic dispatcher that creates an in‑host model instance appropriate to
061         * the provided configuration.
062         *
063         * <p>
064         * This method inspects the runtime type of the supplied
065         * {@link InHostConfiguration} and forwards to the corresponding specialised
066         * initialiser. It keeps the initialisation code in a single place so that
067         * the {@link #initialisePerson} method need only call a single entry point
068         * when creating the in‑host component of the person state.
069         *
070         * <p>
071         * Implementers of additional in‑host model types should add an appropriate
072         * branch here or extend the dispatch mechanism to use a registry if more
073         * dynamic behaviour is required.
074         *
075         * @param <CFG>      concrete in‑host configuration type
076         * @param config     the in‑host configuration instance
077         * @param execConfig the (possibly demographic adjusted) execution
078         *                   configuration
079         * @param person     optional person demographic used when applying
080         *                   demographic adjustments
081         * @param rng        sampler used to draw distributional entries
082         * @param time       current simulation time used for time‑dependent
083         *                   initialisation
084         * @return an {@link InHostModelState} instance suitable for the supplied
085         *         config
086         * @throws RuntimeException if the configuration type is not recognised
087         */
088        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
089        default <CFG extends InHostConfiguration> InHostModelState<CFG> initialiseInHostModel(
090                        CFG config, ExecutionConfiguration execConfig,
091                        Optional<PersonDemographic> person, Sampler rng, int time
092        ) {
093                if (config instanceof PhenomenologicalModel)
094                        return (InHostModelState<CFG>) this.initialiseInHostModel(
095                                        (PhenomenologicalModel) config, execConfig, person, rng, time
096                        );
097                if (config instanceof StochasticModel)
098                        return (InHostModelState<CFG>) this.initialiseInHostModel(
099                                        (StochasticModel) config, execConfig, person, rng, time
100                        );
101                if (config instanceof MarkovStateModel)
102                        return (InHostModelState<CFG>) this.initialiseInHostModel(
103                                        (MarkovStateModel) config, execConfig, person, rng, time
104                        );
105                throw new RuntimeException("Unknown in host configuration type");
106        }
107
108        /**
109         * Convert a baselined {@link Person} into an immutable runtime
110         * {@link ImmutablePersonState}.
111         *
112         * <p>
113         * Key steps performed by the default implementation:
114         * <ol>
115         * <li>Adjust the outbreak {@link ExecutionConfiguration} for the
116         * individual's demographic group using {@link ReflectionUtils#modify}.</li>
117         * <li>Obtain the {@link SetupConfiguration} and compute an importation
118         * exposure probability using {@link SetupConfiguration#getInitialImports()}
119         * and the network size (this implements a simple uniform seeding
120         * strategy).</li>
121         * <li>Set simple per‑person modifiers (transmissibility, mobility,
122         * compliance, susceptibility, app use) to conservative defaults. These may
123         * be adjusted by downstream mechanisms or policies.</li>
124         * <li>Create the in‑host model instance by delegating to
125         * {@link #initialiseInHostModel(InHostConfiguration, ExecutionConfiguration, Optional, Sampler, int)}
126         * which dispatches to the specific in‑host initialisers based on the
127         * concrete configuration type.</li>
128         * <li>Set importation exposure and initial immunisation dose.</li>
129         * </ol>
130         *
131         * <p>
132         * Configuration driven behaviour: behaviour is governed by the outbreak's
133         * execution and setup configuration. Demographic adjustments derived from
134         * {@link ExecutionConfiguration#getDemographicAdjustment()} can change
135         * sampled values for distributions and therefore alter the realised
136         * per‑person initial state. The importation exposure is derived from
137         * {@link SetupConfiguration#getInitialImports()} and
138         * {@link SetupConfiguration#getNetwork()}.
139         *
140         * <p>
141         * Extension guidance: implementers that wish to alter only the in‑host
142         * initialiser should implement one of the specialised
143         * {@code DefaultInHost...Initialiser} interfaces; larger changes to the
144         * person initialisation orchestration can be achieved by subclassing
145         * {@code DefaultModelBuilder} and overriding the delegation point. Avoid
146         * heavy IO in this method; if expensive per‑person computation is required
147         * prefer to precompute aggregates during outbreak baselining.
148         *
149         * @param builder the person state builder to populate
150         * @param person  the person to initialise (must have a baselined state)
151         * @param rng     a random sampler used for stochastic choices
152         * @return the initialised {@link ImmutablePersonState}
153         */
154        default ImmutablePersonState initialisePerson(
155                        ImmutablePersonState.Builder builder, Person person, Sampler rng
156        ) {
157                ExecutionConfiguration params = ReflectionUtils.modify(
158                                person.getOutbreak().getExecutionConfiguration(),
159                                person.getOutbreak().getExecutionConfiguration()
160                                                .getDemographicAdjustment(),
161                                person.getDemographic()
162                );
163
164                SetupConfiguration configuration = person.getOutbreak()
165                                .getSetupConfiguration();
166                // PersonBaseline baseline = person.getBaseline();
167                double limit = ((double) configuration.getInitialImports())
168                                / configuration.getNetwork().getNetworkSize();
169
170                builder.setTransmissibilityModifier(1.0).setMobilityModifier(1.0)
171                                .setComplianceModifier(1.0).setSusceptibilityModifier(1.0)
172                                .setAppUseModifier(1.0)
173
174                                .setInHostModel(
175                                                this.initialiseInHostModel(
176                                                                params.getInHostConfiguration(), params,
177                                                                Optional.ofNullable(person.getDemographic()), rng,
178                                                                person.getOutbreak().getCurrentState().getTime()
179                                                )
180                                ).setImportationExposure(rng.uniform() < limit ? 2.0 : 0)
181                                .setImmunisationDose(0D);
182
183                return builder.build();
184        }
185
186}
